# completionCurve

**Instance Property**

Returns the completion curve associated with the transition.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var completionCurve: UIView.AnimationCurve { get }
```

## Return Value

The completion curve for the view controller transition. For a list of possible values, see the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/AnimationCurve] type.

## Discussion

The completion curve defines the timing of the animations. For interactive transitions, this value is usually obtained from the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewControllerInteractiveTransitioning/completionCurve] property of the interactive animator object. Use this value when configuring your own animations if you want the same timing as the main transition.

## Getting the behavior attributes

- **presentationStyle**: The presentation style to use for the transition.
- **transitionDuration**: Returns the noninteractive duration of a transition.
- **completionVelocity**: Returns the starting velocity to use for any final animations.
- **percentComplete**: Returns the percentage of completion for an interactive transition when it moves to its noninteractive phase.
